name: Longjing (Dragon Well)
description: A delicate green tea from Hangzhou with a fresh, sweet flavor and distinctive flat-pressed leaves. Known for its jade color and subtle chestnut aroma.

name: Tieguanyin (Iron Goddess of Mercy)
description: A premium oolong tea with a complex floral fragrance and honey-like sweetness. The leaves unfurl beautifully when steeped.

name: Pu-erh
description: A fermented dark tea that improves with age. Rich, earthy flavor with deep complexity and smooth finish. Often compressed into cakes.

name: Keemun Black Tea
description: A malty black tea with wine-like and fruity characteristics. Smooth body with hints of chocolate and a bright copper color.

name: Silver Needle (Bai Hao Yin Zhen)
description: The most prized white tea made from young buds covered in silver down. Delicate, subtle sweetness with a clean, refreshing taste.
